page.title: 09THE COMMUNITY OF CALF HEATH
page.content: The newer inhabitants of the modernised homes invariably travel many miles to work and with the children travelling to school by coach the village is deserted during the day.The sad result of this seems to be a definite lack of community spirit and friendship usually found in a village of this size.The limited bus service to the local town of Cannock is now very poorly used and in danger of being axed completely.This of course would mean considerable hard- ship to the older people who rely on this service to reach the shops and doctor etc.Similarly the combined post office and general store is also very little used and cannot be a viable proposition for much longer.The fine village hall is used mainly for private functions such as wedding receptions and buffet dances.
